title.narrative: 4.1 POLICIES, LAWS, BUDGETS & PLANS

description.narrative: By 2017, strengthened enabling policy legislative and budgetary environment at national and provincial level for the protection of children and women in accordance with international norms and standards related to child protection, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children's rights to protection from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect are being addressed through system reform and strengthening of child protection systems at national and provincial levels.

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL PROGRAMME FOR FP AND PHC

sector.narrative: ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, strengthened enabling policy legislative and budgetary environment at national and provincial level for the protection ofchildren and women in accordance with international norms and standards related to child protection

description.narrative: Legislative frameworks for the protection of children in Balochistan, GB (Bill) and the Islamabad Capital Territory developed/enacted; child labour surveys underway in KP, Punjab and Sindh to inform policy development; draft birth registration bye-laws developed in Sindh, and child protection mapping and assessment findings endorsed by Government of FATA | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: of laws enacted/amended containing a minimum of 25% equity-focused legislative provisions in accordance with international minimum standards
of evidence based researches, studies, evaluations are conducted that inform the programing
of equity-focused policies aligned with international minimum standards notified
of Child Protection Mapping and Assessments officially endorsed at provincial and area level
Existence of legislation that recognize children's right to be heard in civil and administrative proceedings that affect them (in line with Article 12 of the CRC)

actual.value: 2017:1 (Child Protection Bill enacted in Balochistan) and in the Islamabad Capital TerritoryThe Federal Juvenile Justice System Act, 2017.
